channel.title: Invalid Display Settings
channel.description: Hi, i was doing an English assignment on microsoft Word 2007. I was dealing with foreign language when i needed a "ü". numlock was off when i pressed the required numbers for it (0252) but instead of holding Alt i held Alt Gr (dont know the difference). After doing that my screen resolution went down automatically (screen flashed though). When i went to display settings, i got a message telling me that the selected graphics display driver cannot be used, and that its not compatible with this version of Vista. After pressing ok, the resolution bar said -1 by -1 and i cannot move the bar. Colours is blank. anyone know how to increase the resolution, and get rid of the error message?

item.title: Invalid Display Settings
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Lil Master:

alt + #

That’s what usually happens when you try to use one abandoned and forgotten feature. You stumble upon another one.

Read full topic

item.title: Invalid Display Settings
item.dc:creator: gugamilare
item.description:
Lil Master:

[…] but instead of holding Alt i held Alt Gr (dont know the difference).[…]

Gr means Greek. You can use it to write Greek letters. I’m not able to use it right now as a demonstration, probably because I’m using Windows (not in my PC), but in Linux in my PC it works. You can also use it to write ¹ ² ³ £ ¢ ¬ § ª º ° (which, in my keyboard, are written using the keys 1 2 3 4 5 [ ] and /).

Read full topic

item.title: Invalid Display Settings
item.dc:creator: Nihilanth
item.description:
Have you tried to run in safe mode? Other wise try to press alt + ctrl plus 0 (zero) on the numpad. This should reset the display back to normal.

If this worked go to your desktop and right click>Graphic Options>Hot keys>Disable. That will keep the problem from happening again

Read full topic

item.title: Invalid Display Settings
item.dc:creator: Lil_Master
item.description:
Hi, i was doing an English assignment on microsoft Word 2007.
I was dealing with foreign language when i needed a “ü”. numlock was off when i pressed the required numbers for it (0252) but instead of holding Alt i held Alt Gr (dont know the difference).
After doing that my screen resolution went down automatically (screen flashed though). When i went to display settings, i got a message telling me that the selected graphics display driver cannot be used, and that its not compatible with this version of Vista.
After pressing ok, the resolution bar said -1 by -1 and i cannot move the bar. Colours is blank. anyone know how to increase the resolution, and get rid of the error message?
